poem:
"Corporate Ladder Ascension"

She wore a dress spun of ledgers,
each strand a ticker tape of fortune,
riding on the meandering markets' currents.
From humble beginnings to Toft heights,
her boss's chair an opulant perch,
now 12.7 million sterling reasons richer.
Every step up inked with endeavour,
each share a notch in her gain,
In the grand FTSE 100 game.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "GSK boss’s annual pay package jumps 50% to £12.7m The annual pay package of the boss of GlaxoSmithKline, Emma Walmsley, has jumped by 50% to £12.7m, mainly because of a higher share bonus payout reflecting the British drugmaker’s improved performance. Walmsley’s huge pay rise makes her one of the highest-paid executives in the FTSE 100 index of Britain’s leading shares, a week after it emerged her counterpart at Britain’s biggest pharmaceutical firm AstraZeneca, Pascal Soriot,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Walmsley’s huge pay rise makes her one of the highest-paid executives in the FTSE 100 index of Britain’s leading shares, a week after it emerged her counterpart at Britain’s biggest pharmaceutical firm AstraZeneca, Pascal Soriot,
